choicegroup.label: What do you think would be the value of the variable result after executing the following segment of Java code?

div.p: Both int and float are 32-bit types. All the 32 bits of int are used for representing the integral part of a numerical value. However, for float, some bits are used for representing the integral part and some for the decimal part. When assigning a large integral value to a float variable, the reduced number of bits for its integral part may not be able to precisely represent the large value. Therefore, calculating the difference between int and float variables of the same large numerical value, may not always give a result of 0. You may want to test the code indicated above in a Java program.
